result.execSummary:
The defendant Antoine D Davenport was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges during the period of probation. Court waived all waivable costs. Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.

- Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant NOT possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
- Take medication prescribed in the manner as prescribed.
- No Contact with victim Shakena R. on case 15CM1625.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Defendant sentenced to serve 150 days (STRAIGHT TIME) in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 (zero)  days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   As a condition of probation, the Court ordered
          the defendant to serve 60 days (STRAIGHT TIME)
          in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed 
          to be used at the agent's discretion.
     *   Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed
          medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.          
     *   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or
          use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
     *   Take medication prescribed in the manner as prescribed.     
     *   No contact with victim Shakena R. on case #15CM1625.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges during the period
           of probation. Court waived all waivable costs. 
          Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due  
          immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
     *   No firearms; weapons
     
 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights; received and filed.

Defendant Antoine D Davenport in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Antoine D Davenport in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

AS TO COUNT 2:

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Antoine D Davenport not in court, in custody and not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing hearing. Court is in jury trial for today's proceedings. State is missing 11CM7287 file and needs additional time for victim notification. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Antoine D Davenport not in court, in custody and not produced.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status conference for today's proceedings / defendant not produced.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status conferenc. New attorney - need discovery, etc.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Shakena R

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Antoine D Davenport in court with attorney Bernard S. Stein.  Defendant Antoine D Davenport in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
